definition: Shōwa, Japanese era name, corresponding to the reign (1925-1989) of emperor Hirohito 裕仁[Yu4 ren2]
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"

sentences.english: First, justice Japan' s Showa period, Tanaka was the first person to warlords in power.
sentences.chinese: 田中义一是日本昭和时期军阀当政的第一人。

sentences.english: Ryu Murakami is the author of “Popular Hits of the Showa Era.”
sentences.chinese: 村上龙是《昭和歌谣大全》的作者。

sentences.english: Dali, the historic center of the Nanzhao and Dali kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 大理市，南昭和大理王国的历史遗址所在地。

sentences.english: The regime of Mikado Showa Hirohito is the longest in Japanese history.
sentences.chinese: 昭和天皇裕仁是日本历史上在位时间最长的天皇。

definition: Akihito, personal name of the Heisei 平成[Ping2 cheng2] emperor of Japan (1933-), reigned 1989-2019
Heisei, Japanese era name, corresponding to the reign (1989-2019) of emperor Akihito 明仁[Ming2 ren2]
Taishō, Japanese era name, corresponding to the reign (1912-1926) of emperor Yoshihito 嘉仁[Jia1 ren2]
Japanese surname and place name Oukubo
Muromachi bakufu, the feudal government of Japan (1338-1573) under the Ashikaga shoguns
